Return both lines and the two names. We have snapshot with evidenceCount=1 and recentEvidencePointers includes "14:1.1.1.p11". So previously we already found one occurrence. Now need to scan current batch items for any paragraphs fitting pattern.

Check each markdown:

Item 39: markdown starts with "– Вы бы сами..." Not a name colon.

Item 40: "– Ещё не остывшее расплавленное вещество! – закричал кто-то из слушателей." No name colon.

Item 41: "– Верно! – подхватил Знайка. – Ещё не остывшее..." No name colon.

None have pattern Name colon. Also note they start with dash not name. So no new evidence. Should output decision "continue" (since more batches remain). No newEvidence.

Make sure not to include pointer from recent evidence. So empty list.

Thus JSON: {"decision":"continue","newEvidence":[]}"},"finish_reason":"stop"}],"usage":{"prompt_tokens":903,"completion_tokens":259,"total_tokens":1162}}
